name: df-lmim
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(clmim, cmpo(s0, s1, clmod, clmod, crab(s2, co(cv(s0), clmhm, cv(s1)), wf1o(cv(s2), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ LMIso =(s0 ∈ LMod, s1 ∈ LMod ↦ { s2 ∈(s0[LMHom]s1)|(s2 :(Base ` s0)↔(Base ` s1))})
comment: An isomorphism of modules is a homomorphism which is also a bijection, i.e. it preserves equality as well as the group and scalar operations. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.)
